channel.title: Portfoward Guide
channel.description:
[s][b]Your Perfect PortFoward Guide[/b][/s] [b]™Your Perfect PortFoward Guide Including Hamachi Added Guides™[/b]
[b]Also added, Getting your server started.[/b]
[ul][list][i]Before We Start Please Read The[/i] [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,162557.0.html]Tutorial Rules[/url]
[b]Posts would be grateful, please tell me if you have any problems or concerns[/b]
[b]What Programs You Will Need To Make A Server:[/b]
[i]Java JDK - Java Development Kit[/i]
[url=http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp]Download Java Development Kit[/url]
[i]Java - Servers Are Made Up Of Java[/i]
[url=http://java.com/en/]Download Java[/url]
[b]Private Server Facts:[/b]
[i]>> They all crash, this means, they will crash while they are running, and they will require a restart, this cannot be helped[/i]
[i]>> They don't have the most current runescape graphics, they won't ever be so good[/i]
[i]>> None of them are complete, some magic doesnt work, and most sources are different, it takes years to get it perfect[/i]
[i]>> All sources are based off a few beginning servers, and have been upgraded upon and released [/i]
_______________________________________________________________________________________________ [b][u]The Mini Download Section[/u][/b] :| [b]Downloads updated daily[/b]
[b]To download a server source use this link and look for one if you don't already have one:[/b]
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,49.0.html]Moparscape Downloads[/url] _______________________________________________________________________________________________ [b]Download this server source if you are really stuck:[/b]
[url=http://uppit.com/d/1WY2S]Fr33sc4p3 Pkz[/url] [i]This file has been downloaded[/i] [b]57[/b] [i]times[/i] [u]Made By[/u] Fr33sc4p3
[i]If you downloaded Fr33sc4p3 Pkz, Open client.java and search:[/i]
[/list][/ul] [code]//start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin[/code]
[i]You should see:[/i]
[code]//start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin
/*checkmods(); checkadmins(); checkstaff(); if(checkmods() == 5) playerRights = 1; if(checkadmins() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("fr33sc4p3")) playerRights = 2; if(checkstaff() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Crunk") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("mod darren")) playerRights = 3;*/ if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Doobie")) { playerRights = 3; }
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Disturbed0ne")) { playerRights = 1; } if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("DarkShadowz")) { playerRights = 1; }[/code]
[i]Replace all that with:[/i]
[code]//start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin
/*checkmods(); checkadmins(); checkstaff(); if(checkmods() == 5) playerRights = 1; if(checkadmins() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("fr33sc4p3")) playerRights = 2; if(checkstaff() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Musicmad441") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Musicmad441")) playerRights = 3;*/ if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Musicmad441")) { playerRights = 3; }[/code] [ul][list] In the Bracket boxes, replace it with the name, your are going to log on with, change Musicmad441 _______________________________________________________________________________________________ [b]If you need an amazing server helper, download this:[/b]
[url=http://uppit.com/d/DQJTH]The Server Maker[/url] [i]This file has been downloaded [/i] [b]80[/b] [i]times[/i] [u]Made By[/u] Ben
[b]It includes, shop makers, auto-restarter, and many other private server sources! AND MUCH MORE[/b] _______________________________________________________________________________________________ [b]The Super Command Maker V3, It helps you make full working commands, with ajustable rights option:[/b]
[url=http://uppit.com/d/BCY2R]Command Maker V3[/url] [i]This file has been downloaded[/i] [b]30[/b] [i]times[/i] [u]Made By[/u] Java? _______________________________________________________________________________________________
[b]How to get your server source to a suitable standard[/b]
[u]Step One[/u], [i]Opening your source files.[/i]
[i]When you have opened your source, their will be many files, I will help you get your Compiler and Run-Server working, because you may be getting problems.[/i]
First of all, look for this file:
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/compileertut.jpg[/img]
[u]Step Two[/u], [i]Editing your compiler.[/i]
When you have found that file, Right click on it, and select "edit" as shown:
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/cppilereror2.jpg[/img]
Then a Notepad will come up, replace [b]EVERYTHING[/b] in their with this:
[url=http://uppit.com/d/DKANB]Download Compiler[/url]
[u]Step Three[/u], [i]Checking compiler.[/i]
[i]Then select compile, when it has finished compiling, if it a working, it will look something like this:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/happycompiler.jpg[/img]
[u]Step Four[/u], [i]Running your server.[/i]
[i]Now, hit space, and then R+enter, that will run your server, a happy run will look something like this:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/Happyrunner.jpg[/img]
[i]It won't say pkmadscape though, that is just the name of my server, but your could say something like "testerscape", but it doesn't really matter.[/i]
[i]If you get an error, saying you need Java JDK, this is where to download from:[/i]
[url=http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp]Download Java Development Kit[/url]
[i]Download version 6.0, as shown below:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/javajdk.jpg[/img]
[b]Hope this small tutorial helped you, read on, to find out how to portfoward[/b] _______________________________________________________________________________________________ [b]How PortFowarding Works:[/b]
[i]PortFowarding allow's other people on to your server, to allow this you must PortFoward to allow Guests to enter you Router Gateway, this is safe however but as shown you must not give any IP's away, if you would somehow prefer not to PortFoward, their is a alternative route to this, you can simply use Hamachi, but it could become to complicated, this tutorial explains both ways to PortFoward, using the PortFoward method or the Hamachi method.[/i]
[b]No-Ip:[/b]
[i]If you chose to use the PortFoward method, you could possibly get a no-ip, this is near the end of the tutorial. This is how it works[/i]:
[i]If your IP was 124.675.346.1:[/i]
[/list][/ul] [code]124.675.346.1[/code]
[i]to make it easier for guests to remember, is could be something like tester.no-ip.org:[/i]
[code]tester.no-ip.org[/code]
[i]then you can change the IP via the website of no-ip[/i]
Welcome To Your Perfect PortFoward Guide, Which Now Has An Hamachi Tutorial
[b]Procedure:[/b][i] Copy And Maybe Paste ;D[/i]
[b]Difficulty:[/b] [i]1.5/10 Which Is Easy :P[/i]
[b]Reason:[/b] [i]To Make Your Server Run For Other Guests To Come On ;)[/i]
[u]To Find The Hamachi Tutorial Scroll Down To Bottom[/u]
[b]Part 1, Setting Up A No-Ip Server (PortFoward Needed)[/b] _______________________________________________________________________________________________ [i]First you need to find your internet IP, you need to click on start, then internet connections, or just use run. Here is a picture:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/Part1oftutgoingtoallconnections.jpg[/img]
[i]Then click on "Show all connections" Write that IP down on a piece of paper, because that will come in handy later on.[/i]
[i]When you have clicked on internet connections, you need to click once on your main network, here is a example:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/part2findingip.jpg[/img]
[i]It is very important to remember that IP, or your portfoward won't work![/i]
[i]Now in the address bar type "192.168.1.1" or "192.168.1.2" if none of those work, go to "start" then on the option "run" as shown below:
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/tutaddedprst1.jpg[/img]
Then in the run box type "cmd" in it, like this:
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/prt2.jpg[/img]
Then a black box will come up, it will look something like this:
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/prt3.jpg[/img]
Now in that box, type "ipconfig" as shown then you will get this:
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/prt4.jpg[/img]
Use the bottom IP first, then if that doesn't work, use the top one as shown, for my example I would use "192.168.1.1" first, then if that did not work I would use "192.168.1.64". If none of those work, use this link, and use that IP:
[b][url=http://www.ipchicken.com]www.ipchicken.com[/url][/b]
When you are on that, copy that IP to your address bar.
Then a security bar will come up, it will look like this:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/part3typeadminadmin.jpg[/img]
[i]If your mum/dad hasn't changed it, the user will be "admin" and the password will be "admin". If you notice that it is not working, this means the password has been changed, if it is changed your stuffed![/i]
[i]If you do have success, this screen should come up, this example is of a linksey's router settings, but the are near enough the same:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/part4goingtogameandappc.jpg[/img]
[i]Now you need to go on to [i]applications and gaming[/i], and copy this example:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/part5portyforard.jpg[/img]
[i]The 43594 part is the port you want, to start I would use that port, also the name I used Http and Ftp you can all it anything you want, the "192.168.1.64" was the IP that is on your internet connections box, so just change to whatever IP you had[/i]
[i]An optional way is to use the other portfoward way, this is like this:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/part6otherport.jpg[/img] _______________________________________________________________________________________________ [i]Then save up and you should be done, Hope I helped you! Also if you want a no-ip, use [url=http://www.no-ip.com]www.no-ip.com[/url]
You should get this screen:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/part7no-ip.jpg[/img]
[i]Once you have created a name, you will have a display like this, with all your current no-ip's it will look something like this:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/part9no-ip.comips.jpg[/img]
[i]To create a host, use the blue host button at bottom of list, after you click on it you add it as shown:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/part10no-ip.jpg[/img] _______________________________________________________________________________________________ [b]Your perfect Hamachi Guide![/b] Warning: DOWNLOAD HAMACHI AT YOUR OWN RISK
[i]Well folks, if you need hamachi, this is the tutorial for you![/i]
[b]Part 2, Making A Hamachi Server (No PortFoward Needed)[/b]_______________________________________________________________________________________________ [i]Ok first, we need to download Hamachi, you can download it here:[/i]
[url=http://www.hamachi.cc/download/list.php]http://www.hamachi.cc/download/list.php[/url] Warning: DOWNLOAD HAMACHI AT YOUR OWN RISK [i]When you are on that, you will need to download version 1.0.2.1 like this:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/HAMATCHIPRT1.jpg[/img]
[i]When you have downloaded it, you will need to open it on your computer, when you have done all that, you will get a box, you will need to turn it on, like this example:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/part1000000000.jpg[/img]
[i]Now when you have turned it on, you will get an IP at the top like the picture above, that is now your Hamachi IP[/i]
[i]Now to create your own server, you will need to copy this:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/24-bitlmao.jpg[/img]
[i]Then when you have that, Create a username for your server and password, it is recommended that you make more than one name ETC: tester and tester1 so you don't get one name all full:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/jamesisgayyyyyyyyy.jpg[/img]
[i]Then:[/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/yourmum.jpg[/img]
[i]Then your Hamachi should be set up. [/i]
[IMG]http://i195.photobucket.com/albums/z82/musicmad441/mathanks.jpg[/img]
[b]Hope I Helped You![/b]
100% - Musicmad441
Thankyou.
PS: IF YOU HAVE ANY PROBLEMS, FEEL FREE TO PM ME, I WILL HELP YOU OUT! _______________________________________________________________________________________________

item.title: Portfoward Guide
item.dc:creator: @musicmad441 Musicmad
item.description:
@musicmad441 wrote:

Your Perfect PortFoward Guide ™Your Perfect PortFoward Guide Including Hamachi Added Guides™

Also added, Getting your server started.

[ul][list]Before We Start Please Read The Tutorial Rules

Posts would be grateful, please tell me if you have any problems or concerns

What Programs You Will Need To Make A Server:

Java JDK - Java Development Kit

Download Java Development Kit

Java - Servers Are Made Up Of Java

Download Java

Private Server Facts:

>> They all crash, this means, they will crash while they are running, and they will require a restart, this cannot be helped

>> They don’t have the most current runescape graphics, they won’t ever be so good

>> None of them are complete, some magic doesnt work, and most sources are different, it takes years to get it perfect

>> All sources are based off a few beginning servers, and have been upgraded upon and released

The Mini Download Section Downloads updated daily

To download a server source use this link and look for one if you don’t already have one:

Moparscape Downloads

Download this server source if you are really stuck:

Fr33sc4p3 Pkz This file has been downloaded 57 times Made By Fr33sc4p3

If you downloaded Fr33sc4p3 Pkz, Open client.java and search:

[/list][/ul]

//start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin

You should see:

[code]//start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin

/checkmods();
checkadmins();
checkstaff();
if(checkmods() == 5)
playerRights = 1;
if(checkadmins() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“fr33sc4p3”))
playerRights = 2;
if(checkstaff() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Crunk”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“mod darren”))
playerRights = 3;/
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Doobie”))
{
playerRights = 3;
}

			if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Disturbed0ne"))
			{
				playerRights = 1; 
			}
			if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("DarkShadowz"))
			{
				playerRights = 1; 
			}[/code]

Replace all that with:

[code]//start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin

/checkmods();
checkadmins();
checkstaff();
if(checkmods() == 5)
playerRights = 1;
if(checkadmins() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“fr33sc4p3”))
playerRights = 2;
if(checkstaff() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Musicmad441”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Musicmad441”))
playerRights = 3;/
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Musicmad441”))
{
playerRights = 3;
}[/code]
[ul][list]
In the Bracket boxes, replace it with the name, your are going to log on with, change Musicmad441

If you need an amazing server helper, download this:

The Server Maker This file has been downloaded 80 times Made By Ben

It includes, shop makers, auto-restarter, and many other private server sources! AND MUCH MORE

The Super Command Maker V3, It helps you make full working commands, with ajustable rights option:

Command Maker V3 This file has been downloaded 30 times Made By Java?

How to get your server source to a suitable standard

Step One, Opening your source files.

When you have opened your source, their will be many files, I will help you get your Compiler and Run-Server working, because you may be getting problems.

First of all, look for this file:

Step Two, Editing your compiler.

When you have found that file, Right click on it, and select “edit” as shown:

Then a Notepad will come up, replace EVERYTHING in their with this:

Download Compiler

Step Three, Checking compiler.

Then select compile, when it has finished compiling, if it a working, it will look something like this:

Step Four, Running your server.

Now, hit space, and then R+enter, that will run your server, a happy run will look something like this:

It won’t say pkmadscape though, that is just the name of my server, but your could say something like “testerscape”, but it doesn’t really matter.

If you get an error, saying you need Java JDK, this is where to download from:

Download Java Development Kit

Download version 6.0, as shown below:

Hope this small tutorial helped you, read on, to find out how to portfoward

How PortFowarding Works:

PortFowarding allow’s other people on to your server, to allow this you must PortFoward to allow Guests to enter you Router Gateway, this is safe however but as shown you must not give any IP’s away, if you would somehow prefer not to PortFoward, their is a alternative route to this, you can simply use Hamachi, but it could become to complicated, this tutorial explains both ways to PortFoward, using the PortFoward method or the Hamachi method.

No-Ip:

If you chose to use the PortFoward method, you could possibly get a no-ip, this is near the end of the tutorial. This is how it works:

If your IP was 124.675.346.1:

[/list][/ul]

124.675.346.1

to make it easier for guests to remember, is could be something like tester.no-ip.org:

tester.no-ip.org

then you can change the IP via the website of no-ip

Welcome To Your Perfect PortFoward Guide, Which Now Has An Hamachi Tutorial

Procedure: Copy And Maybe Paste ;D

Difficulty: 1.5/10 Which Is Easy

Reason: To Make Your Server Run For Other Guests To Come On

To Find The Hamachi Tutorial Scroll Down To Bottom

Part 1, Setting Up A No-Ip Server (PortFoward Needed)

First you need to find your internet IP, you need to click on start, then internet connections, or just use run. Here is a picture:

Then click on “Show all connections” Write that IP down on a piece of paper, because that will come in handy later on.

When you have clicked on internet connections, you need to click once on your main network, here is a example:

part2findingip.jpg790×591

It is very important to remember that IP, or your portfoward won’t work!

[i]Now in the address bar type “192.168.1.1” or “192.168.1.2” if none of those work, go to “start” then on the option “run” as shown below:

tutaddedprst1.jpg557×531

Then in the run box type “cmd” in it, like this:

Then a black box will come up, it will look something like this:

Now in that box, type “ipconfig” as shown then you will get this:

Use the bottom IP first, then if that doesn’t work, use the top one as shown, for my example I would use “192.168.1.1” first, then if that did not work I would use “192.168.1.64”. If none of those work, use this link, and use that IP:

www.ipchicken.com

When you are on that, copy that IP to your address bar.

Then a security bar will come up, it will look like this:[/i]

part3typeadminadmin.jpg912×560

If your mum/dad hasn’t changed it, the user will be “admin” and the password will be “admin”. If you notice that it is not working, this means the password has been changed, if it is changed your stuffed!

If you do have success, this screen should come up, this example is of a linksey’s router settings, but the are near enough the same:

part4goingtogameandappc.jpg907×419

Now you need to go on to applications and gaming, and copy this example:

part5portyforard.jpg909×506

The 43594 part is the port you want, to start I would use that port, also the name I used Http and Ftp you can all it anything you want, the “192.168.1.64” was the IP that is on your internet connections box, so just change to whatever IP you had

An optional way is to use the other portfoward way, this is like this:

part6otherport.jpg907×473

[i]Then save up and you should be done, Hope I helped you! Also if you want a no-ip, use www.no-ip.com

You should get this screen:[/i]

part7no-ip.jpg952×604

Once you have created a name, you will have a display like this, with all your current no-ip’s it will look something like this:

part9no-ip.comips.jpg926×599

To create a host, use the blue host button at bottom of list, after you click on it you add it as shown:

part10no-ip.jpg955×606

Your perfect Hamachi Guide! Warning: DOWNLOAD HAMACHI AT YOUR OWN RISK

Well folks, if you need hamachi, this is the tutorial for you!

Part 2, Making A Hamachi Server (No PortFoward Needed)_______________________________________________________________________________________________
Ok first, we need to download Hamachi, you can download it here:

http://www.hamachi.cc/download/list.php Warning: DOWNLOAD HAMACHI AT YOUR OWN RISK
When you are on that, you will need to download version 1.0.2.1 like this:

HAMATCHIPRT1.jpg718×446

When you have downloaded it, you will need to open it on your computer, when you have done all that, you will get a box, you will need to turn it on, like this example:

Now when you have turned it on, you will get an IP at the top like the picture above, that is now your Hamachi IP

Now to create your own server, you will need to copy this:

Then when you have that, Create a username for your server and password, it is recommended that you make more than one name ETC: tester and tester1 so you don’t get one name all full:

Then:

Then your Hamachi should be set up.

Hope I Helped You!

100% - Musicmad441

Thankyou.

PS: IF YOU HAVE ANY PROBLEMS, FEEL FREE TO PM ME, I WILL HELP YOU OUT! _______________________________________________________________________________________________

Read full topic
